      static void SetShapesTexture(Texture2D texture, Rectangle source)
      Set texture and rectangle to be used on rShapes drawing NOTE: It can be useful when using basic rShapes and one single font, defining a font char white rectangle would allow drawing everything in a single draw call

    • Method Detail

      • SetShapesTexture

        public static void SetShapesTexture(Texture2D texture,
                                    Rectangle source)
        Set texture and rectangle to be used on rShapes drawing NOTE: It can be useful when using basic rShapes and one single font, defining a font char white rectangle would allow drawing everything in a single draw call
        Parameters:
        texture - New default shape texture
        source - Defined area of default texture

                               int centerY,
                               float radius,
                               Color color1,
                               Color color2)
        Draw a gradient-filled circle NOTE: Gradient goes from center (color1) to border (color2)

        centerY - Y coordinate of circle center
        radius - length of circle radius
        color1 - color at the beginning of the gradient
        color2 - color at the end of the gradient

      • DrawTriangleFan

        public void DrawTriangleFan(Vector2[] points,
                            int pointsCount,
                            Color color)
        Draw a triangle fan defined by points NOTE: First vertex provided is the center, shared by all triangles By default, following vertex should be provided in counter-clockwise order
        Parameters:
        points - Array of X, Y coordinates
        pointsCount - number of points
        color - color to draw fan

        Draw a triangle strip defined by points NOTE: Every new vertex connects with previous two
        Parameters:
        points - Array of X, Y coordinates
        pointCount - number of points
        color - color to draw strip

                                         Vector2 center,
                                         float radius)

        Parameters:

        center - X, Y coordinate of circle center
        radius - length of the radius
        Returns:

      • CheckCollisionPointTriangle

        public boolean CheckCollisionPointTriangle(Vector2 point,
                                           Vector2 p1,
                                           Vector2 p2,
                                           Vector2 p3)
        Check if point is inside a triangle defined by three points (p1, p2, p3)
        Parameters:
        point - X, Y coordinate to check location
        p1 - X, Y coordinate of triangle
        p2 - X, Y coordinate of triangle
        p3 - X, Y coordinate of triangle
        Returns:
        Is point inside of triangle

        public boolean CheckCollisionRecs(Rectangle rec1,
                                  Rectangle rec2)
        Check collision between two rectangles
        Parameters:
        rec1 - Rectangle to check
        rec2 - Rectangle to check
        Returns:
        Are rectangles colliding

      • CheckCollisionCircles

        public boolean CheckCollisionCircles(Vector2 center1,
                                     float radius1,
                                     Vector2 center2,
                                     float radius2)
        Check collision between two circles
        Parameters:
        center1 - X, Y Position of circle 1 center
        radius1 - Length of radius for circle 1
        center2 - x, Y Position of circle 2 center
        radius2 - Length of radius for circle 2
        Returns:
        Are circles colliding

      • CheckCollisionCircleRec

        public boolean CheckCollisionCircleRec(Vector2 center,
                                       float radius,
                                       Rectangle rec)
        Check collision between circle and rectangle NOTE: Reviewed version to take into account corner limit case
        Parameters:
        center - X, Y coordinate of circle center
        radius - Length of circle radius
        rec - Rectangle to check
        Returns:
        Are circle and rectangle colliding

      • CheckCollisionLines

        @Contract(mutates="param5")
public boolean CheckCollisionLines(Vector2 startPos1,
                                                                Vector2 endPos1,
                                                                Vector2 startPos2,
                                                                Vector2 endPos2,
                                                                Vector2 collisionPoint)
        Check the collision between two lines defined by two points each
        Parameters:
        startPos1 - X, Y coordinate for initial endpoint of line 1
        endPos1 - X, Y coordinate for final endpoint of line 1
        startPos2 - X, Y coordinate for initial endpoint of line 2
        endPos2 - X, Y coordinate for final endpoint of line 2
        collisionPoint - X, Y coordinate for location of collision
        Returns:
        true if lines collide

        public Rectangle GetCollisionRec(Rectangle rec1,
                                 Rectangle rec2)
